Use custom Serial port path: Set a custom serial port name
info_anotherQueryDelay:
A delay is relevant to give the device some time to reset or initialize before the adapter sends out a new message.
Default if empty: 1000
info_obisFallbackMedium: (used for name resolving when no OBIS medium is defined in the incoming data)
info_protocolD0BaudrateChangeoverOverwri: Empty if baudrate from the device is used
info_protocolD0ModeOverwrite: (Empty if the mode should be used which is provided by the device, else A, B, C, D or E is allowed to overwrite
info_protocolD0SignOnMessage:
(Default if empty: ?
to read only default/mandatory values)
info_protocolD0WakeupCharacters:
(NULL characters to sent to wake up the device and give him time to initialize)
Default if empty: 0
info_protocolSmlInputEncoding: Definition of an alternative input data encoding of the incoming SML data. Most likely relevant for TCP transport.
info_requestInterval:
Use 0 for continuos reading/requesting,
Default if empty: 300
info_transportSerialBaudrate:
If empty, protocol defaults are used
(D0: 300, SML: 9600)
info_transportSerialDataBits:
If empty, protocol defaults are used
(D0: 7, SML: 8)
info_transportSerialMessageTimeout:
Defines how long to wait for a valid message before restarting. Consider the baudrate!
Default if empty: 120s
info_transportSerialParity:
If empty, protocol defaults are used
(D0: even, SML: none)
info_transportSerialStopBits:
If empty, protocol defaults are used
(D0: 1, SML: 1)
value_no_overwrite: Use mode defined by the device
value_transport_HttpRequestTransport: Read data from an HTTP URL
value_transport_LocalFileTransport: Read data from a local file
